swp_compiler_ss13.fuc.backend

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • swp_compiler_ss13.fuc.backend.Function

  • public class Function
extends java.lang.Object
    This class corresponds to an LLVM IR function. Each method that begins with "add" generates LLVM IR code and appends it to the functions code.

      • parent

        private Module parent
        The Module, in which this function exists.

      • code

        private java.lang.StringBuilder code
        Holds the function's generated LLVM IR code.

      • variableUseCount

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> variableUseCount
        Maps a variable's name (not its identifier, which is %{name}) to the number of times it has been used in the module already. This is necessary because LLVM's IR allows only for static single assignment (SSA), wich means we have to store the variable's actual value as the destination of a static pointer and generate a new 'use' variable (%{name}.{use_number}) for every time the variable is read from or written to and route the pointer access through that use variable.

      • references

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> references
        Maps TAC references by their name to their destination (another reference, or a variable) and a list in indices into this destination.

      • derivedVariables

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,DerivedType> derivedVariables
        Contains all variables of derived type that have been declared in this function.

      • getUseIdentifierForVariable

        private java.lang.String getUseIdentifierForVariable(java.lang.String variable)
                                              throws BackendException
        Gets a unique use identifier for a variable; no two calls will return the same use identifier.
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable's name
        Returns:
        a free use identifier for the variable
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • cdl

        private java.lang.String cdl(java.lang.String constantOrIdentifier,
                   Type.Kind type)
                      throws BackendException
        Conditionally loads a constant or an identifier. If given a constant, just the leading # character is removed. If given a variable (anything without leading # character), it is being loaded and the temporary register name is returned.
        Parameters:
        constantOrIdentifier - constant (value) or identifier.
        type - the type of the first argument
        Returns:
        a String that can be used in LLVM IR instructions
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

                      java.lang.String dst,
                      java.lang.String src)
                        throws BackendException
        Assigns either a constant value, or the value of one variable (src) to another variable (dst). Only assignments for identical types are allowed.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the assignment
        dst - the destination variable's name
        src - the source constant or the source variable's name

        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addReferenceDerivedGet

        public void addReferenceDerivedGet(Type.Kind derivedType,
                          java.lang.String derived,
                          java.lang.String index,
                          java.lang.String dst)
                            throws BackendException
        Gets a reference to one of the elements/members of a derived type and store the reference in the backend. Does not generate any LLVM IR code.
        Parameters:
        derivedType - the type of the variable or reference being indexed into
        derived - a variable or reference to index into
        index - the index, which internal type depends on derivedType
        dst - the name of the new reference
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveDerivedSetOrGet

        public void addPrimitiveDerivedSetOrGet(Type.Kind derivedTypeKind,
                               java.lang.String derived,
                               java.lang.String index,
                               Type.Kind primitiveType,
                               java.lang.String primitive,
                               boolean set)
                                 throws BackendException
        Gets or sets a primitive value contained inside a derived value.
        Parameters:
        derivedTypeKind - the Type.Kind of the derived value
        derived - the name for either a variable or a reference being the derived value
        index - the index, which internal type depends on derivedTypeKind
        primitiveType - the Type.Kind of the primitive value
        primitive - if setting, a constant (value) or a variable name to read; if getting, the variable where the value is to written
        set - true if setting; false if getting
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveConversion

        public void addPrimitiveConversion(Type.Kind srcType,
                          java.lang.String src,
                          Type.Kind dstType,
                          java.lang.String dst)
                            throws BackendException
        Assigns the value of one variable (src) to another variable (dst), where their types must only be convertible, not identical.
        Parameters:
        srcType - the source variable's type
        src - the source variable's name
        dstType - the destination variable's type
        dst - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveBinaryInstruction

        public void addPrimitiveBinaryInstruction(Quadruple.Operator op,
                                 Type.Kind resultType,
                                 Type.Kind argumentType,
                                 java.lang.String lhs,
                                 java.lang.String rhs,
                                 java.lang.String dst)
                                   throws BackendException
        Adds a generic binary operation of two sources - each can either be a constant or a variable - the result of which will be stored in a variable (dst). All types must be identical.
        Parameters:
        op - the binary operation to add
        resultType - the result type of the binary operation
        argumentType - the argument type of the binary operation
        lhs - the constant or name of the variable on the left hand side
        rhs - the constant or name of the variable on the right hand side
        dst - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrimitiveBinaryCall

        public void addPrimitiveBinaryCall(Quadruple.Operator op,
                          Type.Kind resultType,
                          Type.Kind argumentType,
                          java.lang.String lhs,
                          java.lang.String rhs,
                          java.lang.String dst)
                            throws BackendException
        Adds a call to a argument-homogenous binary functions where each argument can either be a constant or a variable; the result of the function will be stored in a variable (dst). Argument types must both be equal, but may differ from the result type.
        Parameters:
        op - the binary operation to add
        resultType - the type of the binary operation's result
        argumentType - the type of the binary operation's arguments
        lhs - the constant or name of the variable on the left hand side
        rhs - the constant or name of the variable on the right hand side
        dst - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addBooleanNot

        public void addBooleanNot(java.lang.String source,
                 java.lang.String destination)
                   throws BackendException
        Adds a binary not operation, where the source may be either a constant, or a variable, whereas the result must be a variable.
        Parameters:
        source - the constant or name of the variable to be negated
        destination - the destination variable's name
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

               throws BackendException
        Adds the basic return instruction.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to return (exit code)
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addLabel

        public void addLabel(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a label which may be the target of branching instructions.
        Parameters:
        name - the label's name, must be unique in the program

      • addBranch

        public void addBranch(java.lang.String target1,
             java.lang.String target2,
             java.lang.String condition)
               throws BackendException
        Adds a branching instruction, which may either be unconditional (e.g. branch immediately) or depend on a boolean variable 'condition' (e.g. branch to one of two target labels depening on the boolean variable's value at runtime).
        Parameters:
        target1 - target label for unconditional branch, target for the condition being true for conditional branch
        target2 - Quadruple.EmptyArgument for unconditional branch, target for the condition being false for the conditional branch
        condition - Quadruple.EmptyArgument for unconditional branch, the condition being tested for conditional branch
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs

      • addPrint

        public void addPrint(java.lang.String value,
            Type.Kind type)
              throws BackendException
        Adds a call to the printf function for the value, which may be either a constant or the name of a variable.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be printed
        type - the type of the value (boolean, long, double, string)
        Throws:
        BackendException - if an error occurs
